project_name: PLDG Dashboard: Developer Analytics for the Protocol Labs Dev Guild
filecoin_growth_impact:
The PLDG Dashboard contributes to the growth and transparency of the Filecoin economy by tracking and visualizing developer engagement, contributions, and progress across five Protocol Labs Developer Guild (PLDG) cohorts.

By integrating on-chain and off-chain data sources ‚Äî now openly accessible via the PLDG Cohort Data Archive (please visit  https://tinyurl.com/PLDG-Cohort-Data-Archive (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1l4wR_zxqHVdhK2A9G-iKCdxG71vQgGtl?usp=drive_link ) - the dashboard enables:

- Mentors and stewards to identify top contributors for FIL-denominated rewards, grants, and RetroPGF programs.

- Developers to measure their OSS impact, reflect on weekly progress, and align better with Filecoin ecosystem goals (e.g., Storacha, libp2p, and FEVM).

- Ecosystem teams to maintain verifiable contribution records stored on Filecoin via Storacha, ensuring transparent data provenance and usage of FIL-backed storage transactions.

To date, PLDG programs have distributed over $390,000 USD in Filecoin tokens, with the PLDG Dashboard providing continuous visibility into progress, participation, and outcomes across cohorts for contributors to enable better collaboration and improved engagement.

üí° By transforming open-source engagement into measurable impact, the PLDG Dashboard strengthens education, sustainability, and coordination within the Filecoin open economy.
description: From November 2024 to September 2025, the PLDG Dashboard empowered over 100+ developers in the Protocol Labs Developer Guild (https://www.pldg.xyz/) to learn, collaborate, and measure their open-source impact across the Filecoin and Libp2p ecosystems. By combining real-time analytics, AI-driven summaries, and on-chain data storage via Storacha, it enhanced transparency and engagement within cohort programs. The dashboard supported educational mentorship, open-source coordination, and protocol research‚Äîincluding contributions to Libp2p specification development and ecosystem tooling. Through this initiative, emerging builders gained visibility, recognition, and growth pathways, strengthening the foundations of a more open, data-driven decentralized internet.
additional_impact:
Beyond its current use in cohort analytics and community transparency, the PLDG Dashboard is evolving into a cross-ecosystem insights tool for the broader Filecoin and Protocol Labs developer network.

We are expanding its functionality to help active contributors across core repositories use the dashboard as a developer impact and engagement metric ‚Äî offering valuable KPIs that go beyond PR contributions, capturing mentorship, issue resolution, and protocol research participation.

In the next phase, we aim to explore collaborations with the Near Foundation, Ethereum Foundation, and other open-source innovation ecosystems to align impact measurement across decentralized R&D communities.
We are also engaging with contributors to enable them to receive complementary funding from grant programs such as:

Optimism RetroPGF ‚Äì JS-libp2p Project outreach and contributor participation (https://atlas.optimism.io/project/0x5a7e7c7acb21521e99021d746740b368801cbfe531301e50bdbaafdc24a0aac5)

Deep Funding ‚Äì deepfunding.ai (for open-source outreach and exploring collaborative funding opportunities, project feedback; please visit https://x.com/OP_medicine_DAO/status/1979215447175119184 )

Filecoin Open Grants and RFPs ‚Äì Filecoin DevGrants  (https://github.com/filecoin-project/devgrants?tab=readme-ov-file#requests-for-proposals-rfps )

Gitcoin Grants ‚Äì Ecosystem-aligned OSS funding

Polygon Grants ‚Äì polygon.technology/grow


üí° The PLDG Dashboard thus extends beyond analytics ‚Äî it aims to become an ecosystem coordination layer for open-source developers, bridging collaboration, funding, and recognition across multiple Web3 research and protocol communities.
end_user:
The primary beneficiaries of the PLDG Dashboard are:

Developers and contributors in the Protocol Labs Developer Guild (PLDG) who use the dashboard as a self-reflection and insights tool ‚Äî helping them understand their learning patterns, improve productivity, and collaborate more effectively across open-source projects.

Mentors and ecosystem leads within Filecoin, Libp2p, and IPFS programs who rely on its analytics to track engagement, provide feedback, and assess cohort-wide progress in real time.

Protocol researchers and maintainers working on technologies such as Libp2p specifications and Storacha who use aggregated insights to align development efforts and validate ecosystem health.

Collaborative project teams (e.g., working with Py-libp2p or Storacha MCP) that benefit from transparent contribution data, enabling cross-protocol learning and faster coordination.

By offering real-time analytics, AI summaries, and persistent on-chain storage, the PLDG Dashboard empowers individuals and teams alike to reflect, adapt, and grow, making developer participation more intentional, data-informed, and community-aligned.
testimonials:
The PLDG Dashboard has received 10+ public positive testimonials and recommendations from developers, mentors, and ecosystem partners within the Filecoin and Protocol Labs network between December 2024 and October 2025.
 
Please find the link at https://tinyurl.com/pldg-dashboard-testimonials (Long link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jsqh5vc03zKW0Nns42lZROIWab83ARAHTyz8-gBNo3I/edit?usp=sharing )
how_many_package_downloads:
While the PLDG Dashboard is a web-based open analytics platform rather than a traditional SDK, it has been actively cloned, forked, and deployed by contributors across cohorts:

- 27 forks and 8 stars on GitHub

- 10 ecosystem collaborators contributing open datasets via /public

- 15+ live issues and ongoing projects maintained collaboratively

- Viewed and used by 500+ contributors (including 100+ PLDG and 400+ aspiring Filecoin ecosystem developers)


We also developed and shared weekly Storacha integration updates under the guidance of Jamie (ex-Storacha DevRel) and Chaitu from Fil-oz during our collaboration meetings with the Storacha and IPFS teams:  https://tinyurl.com/pldg-dashboard (long link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/198kDYIMFP0VUWNAFhuulHCJYr8LsAlj3O9J91fs1P8U/edit?usp=sharing)

July 2, 2025 Update ‚Äì eKYC CID issuance, role-gated access, billing with Storacha

June 26 Update ‚Äì CSV onboarding, CID annotations, real-time metrics

June 12 Update ‚Äì historical charting and CID provenance layers

June 5 Update ‚Äì CID snapshots and data provenance

May 22 Update ‚Äì AI agents and MongoDB migration toolkit

üìä These iterations directly shaped the new ‚ÄúTheta‚Äù version of the dashboard (https://pldg-dashboard-theta.vercel.app/), improving usability and real-time data integration.
how_many_dependents:
The PLDG Dashboard serves as an enabler and coordination tool across several key Filecoin ecosystem projects, providing a unified, open analytics layer that helps contributors collaborate better, reflect on progress, and visualize impact week over week.

It measures participation, engagement, and research contributions across partner projects including:

Storacha ‚Äì adoption of week-over-week progress visualization for cohort contributors; endorsed by the team and Jamie Steinberg as a model for transparent ecosystem metrics. Please visit https://tinyurl.com/pldg-dashboard (long link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/198kDYIMFP0VUWNAFhuulHCJYr8LsAlj3O9J91fs1P8U/edit?usp=sharing)

Py-libp2p ‚Äì integration for developer coordination and analytics, supporting Libp2p specification research and peer learning within PLDG cohorts.


IPFS & Drand ‚Äì coordination and engagement analytics for distributed systems contributors, improving research visibility and mentor feedback loops.


FEVM Builders & OpenHands OSS (Protocol Labs) ‚Äì insights shared for evaluating developer activity and open-source readiness through transparent progress dashboards.

Collaborative experiments at Onlydust.xyz (Starknet and Stellar blockchain) and Py-libp2p core contributors  ‚Äì core educational and collaboration layer empowering 40+ contributors to track OSS impact and growth across Filecoin-related repositories. 

üí° The PLDG Dashboard helps ecosystem teams see, measure, and improve open-source collaboration, acting as a reflection and analytics companion to developers building the future of the decentralized internet.

üìä Slides overview (as shared at FIL Dev Summit meetings and Engres, the Gathering ): https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/15WzERsBLdPg_I36Cew4M7glKy6-eOWvDueNfel5-wRc/edit?usp=sharing
